title: slimzak
author: slimzak
created_time: November 20, 2022, 11:23:37 PMLast edit: November 20, 2022, 11:34:26 PM by slimzak
content: Does anyone know if PCGS grades funded "buyer-funded" 2013 Lealanas?I know they grade originally funded 2013 lealanas.

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: They grade lealanas and Casascius pieces and I think that’s it for now

comments.author: slimzak
comments.body: Quote from: Bullion-n-BTC on November 20, 2022, 11:24:25 PMThey grade lealanas and Casascius pieces and I think that’s it for nowI know they do, my question is more specific than that. Will they grade a coin labeled as "buyer-funded" if it was funded by the buyer?I am aware so far they haven't been grading unfunded coins unless they were redeemed

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: slimzak on November 20, 2022, 11:26:53 PMQuote from: Bullion-n-BTC on November 20, 2022, 11:24:25 PMThey grade lealanas and Casascius pieces and I think that’s it for nowI know they do, my question is more specific than that. Will they grade a coin labeled as "buyer-funded" if it was funded by the buyer?I am aware so far they haven't been grading unfunded coins unless they were redeemed Pretty sure their grading all Lealana and Casascius. I know that big auction last November at Stacks was a Lealana 0.10 graded by PCGS. It was a BF coin funded after the fact by a buyer

comments.author: slimzak
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptogreatdane on November 20, 2022, 11:45:33 PMQuote from: slimzak on November 20, 2022, 11:26:53 PMQuote from: Bullion-n-BTC on November 20, 2022, 11:24:25 PMThey grade lealanas and Casascius pieces and I think that’s it for nowI know they do, my question is more specific than that. Will they grade a coin labeled as "buyer-funded" if it was funded by the buyer?I am aware so far they haven't been grading unfunded coins unless they were redeemed Pretty sure their grading all Lealana and Casascius. I know that big auction last November at Stacks was a Lealana 0.10 graded by PCGS. It was a BF coin funded after the fact by a buyerThanks. So it was funded before it was sent for grading?Any other instances of "buyer-funded" coins being graded by PCGS?

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: slimzak on November 20, 2022, 11:50:27 PMQuote from: Cryptogreatdane on November 20, 2022, 11:45:33 PMQuote from: slimzak on November 20, 2022, 11:26:53 PMQuote from: Bullion-n-BTC on November 20, 2022, 11:24:25 PMThey grade lealanas and Casascius pieces and I think that’s it for nowI know they do, my question is more specific than that. Will they grade a coin labeled as "buyer-funded" if it was funded by the buyer?I am aware so far they haven't been grading unfunded coins unless they were redeemed Pretty sure their grading all Lealana and Casascius. I know that big auction last November at Stacks was a Lealana 0.10 graded by PCGS. It was a BF coin funded after the fact by a buyerThanks. So it was funded before it was sent for grading?Any other instances of "buyer-funded" coins being graded by PCGS? not sure.. just know it was marked bf. I think i have seen some others but not sure. Ill look and see what i can find.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on November 21, 2022, 12:49:42 AMPCGS is not grading buyer funded LEALANA. If you send buyer-funded LEALANA to PCGS they will send you the coins back not in a slab and ungraded. I have had two of my bf LEALANA pieces sent back to me from PCGS without being graded. Interesting. Do you know where/which PDF form you use for their crypto-submissions and costs etc?  Thanks !

comments.author: slimzak
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on November 21, 2022, 12:49:42 AMPCGS is not grading buyer funded LEALANA. If you send buyer-funded LEALANA to PCGS they will send you the coins back not in a slab and ungraded. I have had two of my bf LEALANA pieces sent back to me from PCGS without being graded. Thanks for sharing. I take it the two BF coins you sent were loaded?

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Lealana BF black 0.1 PCGS slabbedUnless they changed their minds. Seems to me slabbing bf coins would be a safe bet

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: I submitted three bf/black .25 BTC lealanas earlier this year. They returned them unholstered without much explanation. These three coins have a laser edging on the hologram, which I believe was Smoothie experimenting with ways to provide additional security. The laser edging is rare so I assumed they were scared off by this. So, it looks like they are just being extremely cautious. I am working with Stacks Bowers to resubmit these. Steeley
